    • Method Detail

      • copyProperties

        public static <S,​T> T copyProperties​(@NonNull S theSource,
                                           @NonNull Class<T> theTargetClass,
                                           String... theIgnoredProperties)
        Copies properties from source to a new instance of the target class, provided the properties match in name and type. Property names listed within the theIgnoredProperties parameter are skipped.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of the source bean
        T - the type of the target bean
        Parameters:
        theSource - the source bean
        theTargetClass - the target bean's class type; instance is returned by method
        theIgnoredProperties - the property names to skip
        Returns:
        returns a reference to the newly created target bean

      • copyProperties

        @Deprecated(forRemoval=true)
public static <S,​T> T copyProperties​(@NonNull S theSource,
                                           @NonNull T theTarget,
                                           String... theIgnoredProperties)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Use mapProperties(Object, Object) or mapProperties(Object, Class) instead
        Copies properties from source to target, provided they match in name and type. Property names listed within the theIgnoredProperties parameter are skipped.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of the source bean
        T - the type of the target bean
        Parameters:
        theSource - the source bean
        theTarget - the target bean
        theIgnoredProperties - the property names to skip
        Returns:
        returns a reference to the target

      • copyProperties

        @Deprecated(forRemoval=true)
public static <S,​T> T copyProperties​(@NonNull S theSource,
                                           @NonNull T theTarget,
                                           boolean theSkipNulls,
                                           String... theIgnoredProperties)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Use #mapProperties instead
        Copies properties from source to target, provided they match in name and type. Property names listed within the theIgnoredProperties parameter are skipped.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of the source bean
        T - the type of the target bean
        Parameters:
        theSource - the source bean
        theTarget - the target bean
        theSkipNulls - if true, skips copying null source values
        theIgnoredProperties - the property names to skip
        Returns:
        returns a reference to the target

      • registerMapping

        public static <T> void registerMapping​(@NonNull Class<T> theModelClass,
                                       boolean theMapNulls,
                                       String... theIgnoredProperties)
        Registers a mapping to the provided model class from its superclass (class --> superclass). The superclass must be a class other than Object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the subclass (i.e. the model class)
        Parameters:
        theModelClass - the model class
        theMapNulls - map null values in superclass instance to the subclass instance
        theIgnoredProperties - ignored property names while mapping
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - when the superclass is Object

        public static <T> Object valueOf​(@NonNull Class<T> theTargetType,
                                 @NonNull String theStringValue)
        Converts a string value to its scalar or enumerated value equivalent based on the specified target type. If the target type is String, then the specified string value parameter is returned.
        Parameters:
        theTargetType - the target type
        theStringValue - the value in string format
        Returns:
        the wrapped object equivalent of the scalar, a String, or Enum value

      • findBeanOrCreateInstance

        public static <T> T findBeanOrCreateInstance​(Class<T> theClass)
                                      throws Exception
        Given a class, attempts to find and return a bean of the provided class type, and if not found, will construct return an instance of that class. The type must have a public default constructor for the latter case.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the target type
        Parameters:
        theClass - the class of the type to find bean or create instance
        Returns:
        null if the parameter is null; an instance otherwise
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if the bean is not found and an instance cannot be created

      • findBeanOrCreateInstance

        public static <T> T findBeanOrCreateInstance​(Class<T> theClass,
                                             @Nullable Object... theConstructorArgs)
                                      throws Exception
        Throws:
        Exception

      • consumeIfNotNull

        public static <T> void consumeIfNotNull​(T theObject,
                                        Consumer<T> theConsumer)
        Invokes theConsumer only if theObject is not null
        Type Parameters:
        T - the datatype of the object being tested and possibly consumed
        Parameters:
        theObject - the object to be tested and consumed by the theConsumer
        theConsumer - the consumer

      • invokeIfNotNull

        public static <T,​R> R invokeIfNotNull​(T theObject,
                                            Function<T,​R> theFunction,
                                            R theValueIfNull)
        Invokes theFunction only if theObject is not null
        Type Parameters:
        T - the datatype of the object being tested and possibly consumed
        R - the datatype of the return value resulting from invokation of theFunction
        Parameters:
        theObject - the object to be tested and consumed by theFunction
        theFunction - the consumer
        Returns:
        the result of theFunction, null if theObject is null

      • runIfTrue

        public static void runIfTrue​(boolean theCondition,
                             Runnable theRunnable)
        Runs theRunnable only if theCondition is true
        Parameters:
        theCondition - the test condition
        theRunnable - the runnable
